intro: Monenteles serrulatus, commonly known as the serrated monenteles, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite and have serrated edges, giving it its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
